intro: Lepechiniella ulacholica, commonly known as the Andean lepechiniella, is a small, flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, hairy stems, and small, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to pink. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
